titles: An elegy on the death of Thomas Beddingfield esq; who was murdered by Mr. Thomas Barney at Norwich, on Sunday the 20th. day of July, 1684.
publisher: Printed by George Croom, at the Blue-Ball, over against Baynar'd Castle, in Thames-street,
notes: Verse: "The hearts of men can never be at ease ..."
Within mourning borders, with emblems and motto.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Beddingfield, Thomas, d. 1684 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
